channel.title: Can't get an RSPS desktop client to work on my LINUX
channel.description:
I am not trying to run my own server, im trying to play a friends. but the website doesnt connect for me ever, and i don't know why. so he gave me the desktop client through skype, and now when i download cache and everything it gives me a black screen with options to do, saying Try different Java. Reload Browser. Reboot computer.. etc... ive done all the options.
Im running Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.

item.title: Can't get an RSPS desktop client to work on my LINUX
item.dc:creator: @jayseph143 jayseph143
item.description:
@jayseph143 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:545859”][quote author=jayseph143 link=topic=664742.msg4443786#msg4443786 date=1407814918]

It has nothing to do with Linux. In your client, you should see a signlink.java or a folder called sign, and in there a file called signlink.java. Open that up, go to pastebin.com, paste the code there, and give us the link

This is a friends client he’s running so he may not have access to the .java

Make sure your friend isn’t setting the cache directory to anything starting with C:
Linux doesn’t have that drive by default like windows does, so when you try to use the cache and put it in that directory, it errors.

See, i dont know if that’s the problem. it automatically downloads into my Home folder, as usual. But when i open it up it gives an error like you would receive if you refreshed a webclient, with the black screen and yellow writing. i attached a file. it will load for a second then flash to this. i will go and check the directory.

i play other desktop clients and they work fine for my linux PC, but his server for some odd reason doesn’t load.

Try running the file using a shell script to run the jar and see if it prints an error.

it said it’s unable to access jarfile for Arcane-scape.

Try putting “Arcane-scape.jar” (With quotes)Map amount = 660Error: loaderror 60
java.lang.NullPointerException
at client.preloadModels(client.java:229)
at client.startUp(client.java:8347)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84)
at client.run(client.java:5290)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

Map amount = 660Error: loaderror 60
java.lang.NullPointerException
at client.preloadModels(client.java:229)
at client.startUp(client.java:8347)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84)
at client.run(client.java:5290)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

This comes back, the window is also a little rectangle that’s completely un-usable.
[/quote]
Can’t help without seeing that code.
and change “java -jar” to “javaw -jar” in the shell file and that should solve the “little unusable window”[/quote]
What code sorry? and i changed it javaw and it said the command wasn’t found but there are 19 similar commands.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't get an RSPS desktop client to work on my LINUX

item.title: Can't get an RSPS desktop client to work on my LINUX
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It has nothing to do with Linux. In your client, you should see a signlink.java or a folder called sign, and in there a file called signlink.java. Open that up, go to pastebin.com, paste the code there, and give us the link

This is a friends client he’s running so he may not have access to the .java

Make sure your friend isn’t setting the cache directory to anything starting with C:
Linux doesn’t have that drive by default like windows does, so when you try to use the cache and put it in that directory, it errors.

See, i dont know if that’s the problem. it automatically downloads into my Home folder, as usual. But when i open it up it gives an error like you would receive if you refreshed a webclient, with the black screen and yellow writing. i attached a file. it will load for a second then flash to this. i will go and check the directory.

i play other desktop clients and they work fine for my linux PC, but his server for some odd reason doesn’t load.

Try running the file using a shell script to run the jar and see if it prints an error.

it said it’s unable to access jarfile for Arcane-scape.

Try putting “Arcane-scape.jar” (With quotes)Map amount = 660Error: loaderror 60
java.lang.NullPointerException
at client.preloadModels(client.java:229)
at client.startUp(client.java:8347)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84)
at client.run(client.java:5290)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

[/quote]

Map amount = 660Error: loaderror 60
java.lang.NullPointerException
at client.preloadModels(client.java:229)
at client.startUp(client.java:8347)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84)
at client.run(client.java:5290)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

This comes back, the window is also a little rectangle that’s completely un-usable.[/quote]
Can’t help without seeing that code.
and change “java -jar” to “javaw -jar” in the shell file and that should solve the “little unusable window”
